noun.definition: The principal method of human communication, consisting of words used in a structured and conventional way and conveyed by speech, writing, or gesture.
noun.example: A study of the development of language in children.

noun.definition: A system of communication used by a particular country or community.
noun.example: The book was translated into twenty-five languages.

verb.definition: To express in language; to put into words (rare/technical).
verb.example: She struggled to language her complex emotions.

usage_examples: She has a great aptitude for learning languages.
The language of the law can be difficult to understand.
